alert.note: Alert for Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:28AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...An area of rain showers with moderate rainfall will persist across the Danville City and Southern Pittsylvania County through 330 AM EDT this morning... At 222 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of moderate rain tracking northward from Caswell county NC into the southern half of Pittsylvania county, including the city of Danville. HAZARD...Persistent moderate rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding as the ground is saturated from several days of recent rainfall. Locations impacted include... Danville... Providence... Blairs... Gatewood... Westover Hills... Pelham... and Ringgold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: The Danville area has received 2-4 inches of rain over the past 2-3 days. Additional rainfall on saturated ground, even though only light to moderate, may cause minor flooding in poor drainage and low lying flood prone areas. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
